CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, October 24, 1946, pg. 9, reads: "ELABORATE CEREMONY - Miss Christine Elizabeth Bradshaw, niece of Mr. and Mrs. Luther Redmond, became the bride of John Albert Parker, nephew of Mr. and Mrs. McCray of Mt. Vernon Street in an elaborate ceremony performed at Ebenezer Baptist Church recently. The Rev. T. J. King officiated.  Maid of honor was Odessa Murray; bridesmaids included Hurley Williams and Jessica Houston.  Eugene Jeffries was best man and ushers were Pat Lockett and Leroy Bradshaw.  Paula Whacke and Vernetta Easely were flower girls. - Harris Photo." Portions of article read: "...She wore a gown of white satin and tulle with a long court train and a finger tip veil. She carried a [?] bouquet of mums...A charming reception followed the wedding at the home of Mr. and Mrs. Charles Walker..."
TitMainTitle: Group portrait of wedding party with four men wearing tuxedos, including groom John Albert Parker, best man Eugene Jeffries, Leroy Bradshaw, and Pat Lockett; four women, including bride Christine Bradshaw Parker wearing long wedding gown with sheer yoke and holding bouquet of chrysanthemums, maid of honor Odessa Murray, Hurley Williams, and Jessica Houston; and flower girls Paula Whacke and Vernetta Easely, posed in front of dark crushed velvet curtain in Ebenezer Baptist Church, another version
